results.title: More for less
results.creator_credit: Marty Ostrow, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
A series of case studies which show how fossil fuels can either be used more efficiently or replaced altogether by alternative energy sources. The program stresses, however, that unless the alternatives are shown to be economically advantageous, no matter how environmentally desirable renewable energy sources are, they will not replace fossil fuels in the near future. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: More common than measles and mumps
results.creator_credit: Student Animated Film Producers, ONF | NFB, Kiloran German and David Grimes
results.brief_description: An animated film for inclusion in programs of sex education for young people. The subject is venereal disease and the film was produced by young film-makers. The approach is in the form of a cartoon reporting the findings of two students assigned to investigate venereal disease as part of a health studies classroom project. The facts they gather, and convey in this film, are what all young people should know.

results.title: More by design
results.creator_credit: Jean Wadlow, Charles Barker Films, Clydesdale Bank and David Cammell
results.brief_description: Design plays an important part in our lives, and this film has been made to show the remarkable breadth, variety and ingenuity of design which gives colour, form and dimension to everyday life in Scotland. Interviews with Scottish designers who give their opinions on design are mixed with use of design in the manufacture of tapestry, pottery and jewellery and renovation of an ancient castle. Commentary by Magnus Magnusson.

results.title: More bloody meetings: the human side of meetings (NP)
results.brief_description: The sequel to “Meetings, Bloody Meetings”. “More Bloody Meetings” aims to develop the interpersonal skills of chairpersons. Demonstrates techniques to improve people handling skills at meetings in order to improve the decision making process. Features John Cleese and Graeme Garden. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: More awkward customers (NP)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Customer Relations in Practice”.
Emphasises the importance of professional knowledge of an organisation’s stocks or services in dealing with difficult customers. Highlights the customer who parades their knowledge, the silent customer who cannot communicate his needs and the finicky customer who requires every detail. Features John Cleese, Anghared Rees, Patricia Routledge, Bernard Cribbins and Lyn Redgrave. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: More animation greats!
results.brief_description: This disc features a collection of short animated works, produced by the National Film Board of Canada. The contents include: “Cactus swing”. Fun musical short celebrating desert flora and fauna. “La Salla”. Unusual, inventive and fun animated piece about one man exploring his environment, whilst singing Italian opera (with English subtitles). “64 Million years ago”. Stop-motion animated piece that recreates the world of the dinosaur. “Evolution” Humorous illustration about the natural process of evolution. “Hot stuff” Award winning film about fire as the servant of man. “Every dog’s guide to home safety” Hilariously addresses home safety for infants and young children. “The Family that dwelt apart” E. B. White story about a family of seven fisher folk living on a remote island. “The Dingles” The story of Doris Dingles and her three cats one wild and windy day. “Every child = Chaque enfant” The story of a baby who appears mysteriously on the door of a busy executive, and who is subsequently bounced from household to household. These fine works feature world-class animation that delves into children’s rights, relationships, animal behaviour and human frailty. The following works are also available on 16 mm: Hot stuff [012477], Every dog’s guide to home safety [316176], The Family that dwelt apart [012488], The Dingles [301088], The Old Lady’s camping trip [016425], Every child [307146].

results.title: More 'new' handwriting
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor, Materials Production, Curriculum Branch, Ed Dept of Vic and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: This is a sequel to”The New handwriting” which is part of a compilation tape entitled “Learning handwriting” It provides practical advice on such issues as the use of speed loops, alternative letter shapings and embellished handwriting. Also looks at teacher reactions to the change in style.

results.title: Morality: the process of moral development (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Marcus Krigbaum, Davidson Films, Eclipse Films (US) and Roy Anthony Cox
results.brief_description: Dr Susan Merrsemen-Warren and Dr Elliot Turiel interview and test children from the age of four until early adulthood in order to examine their concepts of sharing, fairness, justice, and other attitudes linked to the process of moral development.

results.title: Moral judgement and reasoning (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines various concepts of moral development as postulated by Freud, Piaget and Kohlberg and points out that moral knowledge comes to a child from many sources, including parents, older siblings and playmates.

results.title: Moral development (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Examines two opposing theories of moral development, that of Lawrence Kohlberg who believes that there are stages of moral development tied to cognitive development, and that of the learning theorists who contend that moral behaviour like all behaviour is learned, and that reasons for actions are irrelevant. Using Dr Stanley Milgrim’s famous obedience experiment each of the six stages of moral reasoning is represented in this film, one at a time, by six different participants. The stages differ in the types of reasons a person gives for making a decision about a moral dilemma and in the type of concern the person shows for the self, society, and authority.
